    lendingAccountId integer. The ID of the account in the Order Management System that lends to users so that they can trade on margin.

    Response

    {
    "Id": 1
}
    Key Value
    Id integer. The system responds by returning the value for the ID of the Order Management System.

    AddOperator

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Adds a new operator to a running Order Management System. Operators are the top-level logical entity under which one or more OMS logical instances exist.

    Request

    {
    "OperatorId": 0,
    "OperatorGuid": "",
    "OperatorName": "",
    "DefaultOMSId": 0,
    "Website": "",
    "VerifyURL": "",
    "UseEmailVerify": true,
    "UseRecaptcha": true,
    "RecaptchaPrivateKey": "",
    "RecaptchaPublicKey": ""
}
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator you are creating. You can assign an explicit value for OperatorId, which must be unique, or you can enter 0 and allow the system to assign one for you.
    OperatorGuid string. The globally unique ID (GUID) for the operator. You can assign a GUID to OperatorGuid, which must be unique, or you can enter a null and allow the system to assign one for you.
    OperatorName string. The user name of the operator.
    DefaultOMSId integer. The ID of the Order Management System that the operator primarily administers.
    website string. The URL of the venue operator's website. This website URL is used to populate email templates.
    verifyURL string.
    UseEmailVerify Boolean. A true value tells the Exchange to verify withdrawals using an email and two-factor authentication. A false value requires neither email verification nor 2FA.
    UseRecaptcha Boolean. Turns on (true) or off (false) use of Recaptcha for this operator. Recaptcha is a commercial bot detector.
    RecaptchaPrivateKey string. An alphanumeric string that is is the operator's private key for the Recaptcha bot detector.
    RecaptchaPublicKey string. An alphanumeric string that is the operator's public key for the Recaptcha bot detector.

    Response

    {
    "Id": 6
}
    Key Value
    Id integer. The value for operatorId, either as assigned by the system or echoing back your assignment.

    AddOperatorConfig

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Adds a key-value pair to the set of configuration values for an Operator. The example shows adding a two-factor authentication value for Google2FA. AlphaPoint urges all operators and administrators to use 2FA.

    Other configuration key-value pairs can be used for Google Application ID, and XP Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key values.

    The values of both ConfigId and Config must be strings.

    Request

    {
    "OperatorId": 1,
    "ConfigId": "Google2FA",
    "Config": "1234"
}
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the venue operator being configured.
    ConfigId string. The name of the configuration key.
    Config string. The value of the configuration key.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    AddOperatorOMS

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Assigns an existing Order Management System to an existing user who already has Operator permission.

    Request

    {
    "operatorId": 0,
    "omsId": 0,
    "isDefault": false
}
    Key Value
    operatorId integer. The ID of the operator to whom you will assign the Order Management System.
    omsId integer. The ID of the Order Management System you will assign to the operator.
    isDefault Boolean. If true, this Order Management System is the default OMS for this operator; if false, it is not. An operator can be assigned one default Order Management System.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    CreateOperatorLoyaltyFeeConfig

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Creates a new operator loyalty configuration for discounted transactions involving a specified product (token).

    An exchange can promote activity in a specific cryptocurrency token by offering discounted transaction fees denominated in the token to customers who accept this fee structure. The Loyalty Token is a parallel fee structure that replaces the general set of transaction fees.

    You can set one Loyalty Token per Order Management System. An OMS is not required to offer a Loyalty Token or fee.

    Delete an existing operator loyalty fee configuration using DeleteOperatorLoyaltyFeeConfig.

    Request

    {
    "omsId": 0,
    "loyaltyProductId": 0,
    "loyaltyDiscount": 0.0,
    "referenceProductId": 0,
    "referenceProductPrice": 0.0,
    "isEnabled": true,
    "lastUpdated": "0001-01-01T00:00:00",
    "updatedBy": 0
}
    Key Value
    omsId integer. The ID of the Order Management System where you want to offer the Loyalty Token.
    loyaltyProductId integer. The ID of the loyalty product, a cryptocurrency.
    loyaltyDiscount real. The discount from the standard transaction fee that you are willing to apply. For example, 0.5 (denominated in the loyalty product); a value of 0.5 equals 50%.
    referenceProductId integer. The ID of the default base currency to use to calculate the exchange rate between regular fee products and the discount product. Basis is the last trade price of the product pairing, for example, loyalty product/reference product. See the note below for Reference Product Example.
    refereceProductPrice real. The default market value (see Reference Product Example, below) of a product expressed in a default base currency to use in the event there is no "last traded price" for the XYZ/Reference_product market. This value is applicable only if there is no XYZUSD market on the Exchange (see example).
    isEnabled Boolean. When true, allows transactions to use the Loyalty Token and Fee.
    lastUpdated string. The date and time when the loyalty configuration was last updated, expressed in Microsoft Ticks format and UTC time zone.
    updatedBy integer. The ID of the operator who made the most recent configuration change.

    Reference Product Example — An exchange lists BTCGBP, BITCUSD, ETHBTC, XYZUSD, and XYZGBP. If the regular fee product is BTC on a trade, and you want to give a discount to XYZ, you must convert BTC to XYZ through a default currency because there is no direct BTCXYZ instrument. The Exchange can convert the BTC to XYZ via the default base currency of the instruments of the Exchange, the referenceProductId.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    DeleteOperatorLoyaltyFeeConfig

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Deletes an existing operator loyalty configuration.

    You can set one Loyalty Token per Order Management System. An OMS is not required to offer a Loyalty Token or fee.

    Create an Operator Loyalty Fee using the call CreateOperatorLoyaltyFeeConfig.

    Request

    {
    "omsId": 0,
    "loyaltyProductId": 0,
    "loyaltyDiscount": 0.0,
    "referenceProductId": 0,
    "referenceProductPrice": 0.0,
    "isEnabled": true,
    "lastUpdated": "0001-01-01T00:00:00",
    "updatedBy": 0
}

    Only the values for omsId and loyaltyProductId are required for deleting the specific loyalty fee configuration. Other values are optiona.

    Key Value
    omsId integer. REQUIRED The ID of the Order Management System where the Loyalty Token exists.
    loyaltyProductId integer. REQUIRED The ID of the loyalty product, a cryptocurrency.
    loyaltyDiscount real. The discount from the standard transaction fee that you are willing to apply.
    referenceProductId integer. The ID of the default base currency to use to calculate the exchange rate between regular fee products and the discount product.
    referenceProductPrice real. The default market value of a product expressed in a default base currency to use in the event there is no "last traded price" for the loyalty product market.
    isEnabled Boolean. When true, allows transactions to use the Loyalty Token and Fee.
    lastUpdated string. The date and time when the loyalty configuration was last updated, expressed in Microsoft Ticks format and UTC time zone.
    updatedBy integer. The ID of the operator who made the most recent configuration change.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    GetAllOperatorLoyaltyFeeConfigs

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator, Trading
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Retrieves configuration information for all operators.

    An exchange can promote activity in a specific cryptocurrency token by offering discounted transaction fees denominated in the token to customers who accept this fee structure. The Loyalty Token is a parallel fee structure that replaces the general set of transaction fees.

    Users with Trading permission can get operator loyalty fee configurations that affect accounts with which they're associated; users with Operator permission can get all operator loyalty fee configurations.

    Request

    The Request has no payload.

    {}

    The Request has no payload.

    Response

    [
    {
        "omsId": 0,
        "loyaltyProductId": 0,
        "loyaltyDiscount": 0.0,
        "referenceProductId": 0,
        "referenceProductPrice": 0.0,
        "isEnabled": true,
        "lastUpdated": "0001-01-01T00:00:00",
        "updatedBy": 0
    }
]

    The Response is an array of loyalty fee configurations.

    Key Value
    omsId integer. The ID of the Order Management System where you want to offer the Loyalty Token.
    loyaltyProductId integer. The ID of the loyalty product, a cryptocurrency.
    loyaltyDiscount real. The discount from the standard transaction fee that you are willing to apply. For example, 0.5 (denominated in the loyalty product); a value of 0.5 equals 50%.
    referenceProductId integer. The ID of the default base currency to use to calculate the exchange rate between regular fee products and the discount product. Basis is the last trade price of the product pairing, for example, loyalty product/reference product. See the note below for Reference Product Example.
    refereceProductPrice real. The default market value (see Reference Product Example, below) of a product expressed in a default base currency to use in the event there is no "last traded price" for the XYZ/Reference_product market. This value is applicable only if there is no XYZUSD market on the Exchange (see example).
    isEnabled Boolean. When true, allows transactions to use the Loyalty Token and Fee.
    lastUpdated string. The date and time when the loyalty configuration was last updated, expressed in Microsoft Ticks format and UTC time zone.
    updatedBy integer. The ID of the operator who made the most recent configuration change.

    Reference Product Example — An exchange lists BTCGBP, BITCUSD, ETHBTC, XYZUSD, and XYZGBP. If the regular fee product is BTC on a trade, and you want to give a discount to XYZ, you must convert BTC to XYZ through a default currency because there is no direct BTCXYZ instrument. The Exchange can convert the BTC to XYZ via the default base currency of the instruments of the Exchange, the referenceProductId.

    GetOperatorLoyaltyFeeConfig

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator, Trading
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Retrieves configuration information for a specified operator loyalty fee configuration on a single given Order Management System.

    An exchange can promote activity in a specific cryptocurrency token by offering discounted transaction fees denominated in the token to customers who accept this fee structure. The Loyalty Token is a parallel fee structure that replaces the general set of transaction fees.

    Users with Trading permission can get operator loyalty fee configurations that affect accounts with which they're associated; users with Operator permission can get anyoperator loyalty fee configurations.

    Request

    {
    "omsId": 0,
    "loyaltyProductId": 0
}
    Key Value
    omsId integer. The ID of the Order Management System.
    loyaltyProductId integer. The ID of the loyalty product, a cryptocurrency.

    Response

    {
    "omsId": 0,
    "loyaltyProductId": 0,
    "loyaltyDiscount": 0.0,
    "referenceProductId": 0,
    "referenceProductPrice": 0.0,
    "isEnabled": true,
    "lastUpdated": "0001-01-01T00:00:00",
    "updatedBy": 0
}

    The Response is an array of loyalty fee configurations.

    Key Value
    omsId integer. The ID of the Order Management System where the Loyalty Token is available.
    loyaltyProductId integer. The ID of the loyalty product, a cryptocurrency.
    loyaltyDiscount real. The discount from the standard transaction fee that you are willing to apply. For example, 0.5 (denominated in the loyalty product); a value of 0.5 equals 50%.
    referenceProductId integer. The ID of the default base currency to use to calculate the exchange rate between regular fee products and the discount product. Basis is the last trade price of the product pairing, for example, loyalty product/reference product. See the note below for Reference Product Example.
    refereceProductPrice real. The default market value (see Reference Product Example, below) of a product expressed in a default base currency to use in the event there is no "last traded price" for the XYZ/Reference_product market. This value is applicable only if there is no XYZUSD market on the Exchange (see example).
    isEnabled Boolean. When true, allows transactions to use the Loyalty Token and Fee.
    lastUpdated string. The date and time when the loyalty configuration was last updated, expressed in Microsoft Ticks format and UTC time zone.
    updatedBy integer. The ID of the operator who made the most recent configuration change.

    Reference Product Example — An exchange lists BTCGBP, BITCUSD, ETHBTC, XYZUSD, and XYZGBP. If the regular fee product is BTC on a trade, and you want to give a discount to XYZ, you must convert BTC to XYZ through a default currency because there is no direct BTCXYZ instrument. The Exchange can convert the BTC to XYZ via the default base currency of the instruments of the Exchange, the referenceProductId.

    GetOperatorLoyaltyFeeConfigsForOms

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator, Trading
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Retrieves loyalty fee configuration information for a list of Order Management Systems and loyalty fee products by ID. There can be one loyalty product per Order Management System.

    An exchange can promote activity in a specific cryptocurrency token by offering discounted transaction fees denominated in the token to customers who accept this fee structure. The Loyalty Token is a parallel fee structure that replaces the general set of transaction fees.

    Users with Trading permission can get operator loyalty fee configurations that affect accounts with which they're associated; users with Operator permission can get anyoperator loyalty fee configurations.

    Request

    [
    {
        "omsId": 0,
        "loyaltyProductId": 0
    }
]

    The Request is an array, each element of which specifies an OMS and a loyalty product.

    Key Value
    omsId integer. The ID of the Order Management System.
    loyaltyProductId integer. The ID of the loyalty product, a cryptocurrency.

    Response

    [
    {
        "omsId": 0,
        "loyaltyProductId": 0,
        "loyaltyDiscount": 0.0,
        "referenceProductId": 0,
        "referenceProductPrice": 0.0,
        "isEnabled": true,
        "lastUpdated": "0001-01-01T00:00:00",
        "updatedBy": 0
    },
]

    The Response is an array of loyalty fee configurations.

    Key Value
    omsId integer. The ID of the Order Management System where the Loyalty Token is available.
    loyaltyProductId integer. The ID of the loyalty product, a cryptocurrency.
    loyaltyDiscount real. The discount from the standard transaction fee that you are willing to apply. For example, 0.5 (denominated in the loyalty product); a value of 0.5 equals 50%.
    referenceProductId integer. The ID of the default base currency to use to calculate the exchange rate between regular fee products and the discount product. Basis is the last trade price of the product pairing, for example, loyalty product/reference product. See the note below for Reference Product Example.
    refereceProductPrice real. The default market value (see Reference Product Example, below) of a product expressed in a default base currency to use in the event there is no "last traded price" for the XYZ/Reference_product market. This value is applicable only if there is no XYZUSD market on the Exchange (see example).
    isEnabled Boolean. When true, allows transactions to use the Loyalty Token and Fee.
    lastUpdated string. The date and time when the loyalty configuration was last updated, expressed in Microsoft Ticks format and UTC time zone.
    updatedBy integer. The ID of the operator who made the most recent configuration change.

    Reference Product Example — An exchange lists BTCGBP, BITCUSD, ETHBTC, XYZUSD, and XYZGBP. If the regular fee product is BTC on a trade, and you want to give a discount to XYZ, you must convert BTC to XYZ through a default currency because there is no direct BTCXYZ instrument. The Exchange can convert the BTC to XYZ via the default base currency of the instruments of the Exchange, the referenceProductId.

    GetOperatorOMSList

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Returns an array of Order Management Systems that a given operator can manage.

    Request

    {
    "OperatorId": 1
}
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator whose Order Management Systems you want to return.

    Response

    [
    {
        "OperatorId": 1,
        "OMSId": 1,
        "IsDefault": true
    },
]

    The Response is an array of the Order Management Systems which an operator can manage.

    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator.
    OMSId integer. The ID of the Order Management System.
    IsDefault Boolean. If the value is true, this is the default Order Management System that the operator manages; if the value is false, the OMS is not the default. An operator can have one default Order Management System.

    GetOperators

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Returns a list of operators for the Order Management System on which the call is issued. The call cannot be issued for an Order Management System other than the one where the issuing operator is logged in.

    Request

    {}

    There is no Request payload for this call.

    Response

    [
    {
        "OperatorId": 2,
        "OperatorGuid": "e420b702-b7e9-43f6-82f1-8fc442c3329d",
        "OperatorName": "CME Operator",
        "DefaultOMSId": 1,
        "Website": "",
        "VerifyURL": "",
        "UseEmailVerify": true,
        "UseRecaptcha": true,
        "RecaptchaPrivateKey": null,
        "RecaptchaPublicKey": null
    },
]
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator.
    OperatorGuid string. The globally unique ID (GUID) for the operator.
    OperatorName string. The user name of the operator.
    DefaultOMSId integer. The ID of the Order Management System that the operator primarily administers.
    Website string. The URL of the venue operator's website. This website URL is used to populate email templates.
    VerifyURL string.
    UseEmailVerify Boolean. A true value tells the Exchange to verify withdrawals using an email and two-factor authentication. A false value requires neither email verification nor 2FA.
    UseRecaptcha Boolean. Turns on (true) or off (false) use of Recaptcha for this operator. Recaptcha is a commercial bot detector.
    RecaptchaPrivateKey string. An alphanumeric string that is is the operator's private key for the Recaptcha bot detector.
    RecaptchaPublicKey string. An alphanumeric string that is the operator's public key for the Recaptcha bot detector.

    GetOperatorUsers (DEPRECATED)

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Returns a list of users who are associated with a specific operator.

    In earlier versions of the AlphaPoint Exchange, users were associated with an operator. This is no longer the case. You should not use this call.

    Note: This call is DEPRECATED.

    Request

    {
    "OperatorId": 1
}
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator whose corresponding user IDs you want to return.

    Response

    [
    {
        "operatorId": 0,
        "userId": 0
    }, 
]

    The Response is an array of operator IDs and the user IDs associated with them.

    Key Value
    operatorId integer. The ID of the operator echoed back from the Request.
    userId integer. The user ID associated with that operator ID.

    RemoveOperatorOMS

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Unassigns an existing user with Operator permission from being the operator of an existing Order Management System. The Operator retains his Operator permission; but he is no longer able to manage the specific Order Management System. The Operator retains his user status otherwise.

    To remove a permission from a user (even an Operator permission), use RevokeUserPermission. You cannot remove a user from an Exchange once he is registered. However, you can prevent login by using the SetUserInfo call to set the value of emailVerified to false.

    To set an operator for a specific OMS, call SetDefaultOperatorOMS.

    Note: Don't worry about the situation of removing the last operator from an Order Management System. A SUPERUSER always can assign a new one.

    Request

    {
    "OperatorId": 1,
    "OMSId": 1,
    "IsDefault": true
}
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator you want to remove from managing the Order Management System.
    OMSId integer. The ID of the Order Management System you want to separate or unassign from the Operator.
    IsDefault Boolean. If the value is true, this is the default Order Management System for the operator. If false, it is not.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    RemoveOperatorUser (DEPRECATED)

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Removes a single user from association with a given operator.

    In earlier versions of the AlphaPoint Exchange, users were associated with an operator. This is no longer the case. You should not use this call.

    Note: This call is DEPRECATED.

    Request

    {
    "operatorId": 0,
    "userId": 0
}
    Key Value
    operatorId integer. The ID of the operator whose user you want to remove.
    userId integer. The ID of the user you want to disassociate from the operator.

    Response

    {
    "Success": true
}
    Key Value
    Success Boolean. If true, the user has been successfully removed. If false, the user has not been successfully removed.

    SendEmail

    Category: System
    Permissions: SUPERUSER
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Allows the SUPERUSER (only) to send a broadcast message to the email addresses of one or more people on the Exchange. The SendMail call is used for testing.

    Each email address on the Exchange must be unique.

    Request

    {
    "operatorId": 0,
    "operatorName": "",
    "templateName": "",
    "language": "",
    "fromAddress": "",
    "replyTo": "",
    "function": "",
    "dateTimeFormat": "",
    "defaultTimeZone": "",
    "isEnabled": true,
    "toAddresses": [],
    "bccAddresses": [],
    "templateTokens": {},
    "template": ""
}
    Key Value
    operatorId integer. The ID of the SUPERUSER sending the email.
    operatorName string. The user name of the SUPERUSER sending the email.
    termplateName string. The name of the email template.
    language string. The language in which the email is written. This setting allows the SUPERUSER, for example, to compose and identify one email in English and the same email in Spanish, and to differentiate between the two.
    fromAddress string. The email address from which the email will be sent.
    replyTo string. The email address that any "Reply" or "Reply All" email will automatically be sent to.
    function string. Another instance of the template name, present for backwards-compatibility.
    dateTimeFormat string. The date– and time-format of the timestamp of the email. The AlphaPoint Exchange allows two such formats: POSIX and Microsoft Ticks.
    defaultTimeZone string. The default time zone in which the email is date-and-time-stamped, regardless of where the SUPERUSER is logged in. This can be any time zone. However, all date– and time-stamps in the AlphaPoint exchange are recorded as UTC.
    isEnabled Boolean. If the template is enabled, this is true. If the template is not enabled, this is false.
    toAddresses array of strings. This is an array of email addresses to which the email will be sent.
    bccAddresses array of strings. This is an array of email addresses to which the email will be sent without a record in the message header.
    templateTokens json object. A set of key-value pairs; tokens that tie the template to application data. For example, in a Deposit Request Template, the value for DepositAmount would be filled with the amount of a deposit.
    template string.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    SendEndOfDay

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Sends the end-of-trading-day signal to the specified Order Management System.

    AlphaPoint Exchange installations operate on a trading day that runs from UTC Midnight to UTC Midnight.

    Request

    {
    "omsId": 0,
}
    Key Value
    omsId integer. The Order Management System to which you are sending end-of-day.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    SetDefaultOperatorOMS

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Sets the default Order Management System for a given operator.

    To remove an operator from an Order Management System, use RemoveOperatorOMS.

    Request

    {
    "OperatorId": 1,
    "OMSId": 1,
    "IsDefault": true
}
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator you want to assign to the Order Management System.
    OMSId integer. The ID of the Order Management System you want to assign to the Operator.
    IsDefault Boolean. If the value is true, this is the default Order Management System for the operator. If false, it is not.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    UpdateOperator

    Category: System
    Permissions: Operator
    Call Type: Synchronous

    Updates an operator configuration.

    Request

    {
    "OperatorId": 5,
    "OperatorGuid": "",
    "OperatorName": "",
    "DefaultOMSId": 0,
    "Website": "",
    "VerifyURL": "",
    "UseEmailVerify": true,
    "UseRecaptcha": true,
    "RecaptchaPrivateKey": "",
    "RecaptchaPublicKey": ""
}
    Key Value
    OperatorId integer. The ID of the operator whose configuration you are updating.
    OperatorGuid string. The globally unique ID (GUID) of the operator whose configuration you are updating.
    OperatorName string. The user name of the operator whose configuration you are updating.
    DefaultOMSId integer. The ID of the Order Management System that the operator primarily administers.
    website string. The URL of the venue operator's website. This website URL is used to populate email templates.
    verifyURL string.
    UseEmailVerify Boolean. A true value tells the Exchange to verify withdrawals using an email and two-factor authentication. A false value requires neither email verification nor 2FA.
    UseRecaptcha Boolean. Turns on (true) or off (false) use of Recaptcha for this operator. Recaptcha is a commercial bot detector.
    RecaptchaPrivateKey string. An alphanumeric string that is is the operator's private key for the Recaptcha bot detector.
    RecaptchaPublicKey string. An alphanumeric string that is the operator's public key for the Recaptcha bot detector.

    Response

    {
    "result": true,
    "errormsg": "",
    "errorcode": 0,
    "detail": ""
}

    The Response is a standard response object.

    Key Value
    result Boolean. If the call has been successfully received by the Order Management System, result is true; otherwise it is false.
    errormsg string. A successful receipt of the call returns null. The errormsg key for an unsuccessful call returns one of the following messages:
    Not Authorized (errorcode 20)
    Invalid Response (errorcode 100)
    Operation Failed (errorcode 101)
    Server Error (errorcode 102)
    Resource Not Found (errorcode 104)
    Operation Not Supported (errorcode 106)
    errorcode integer. A successful receipt of the call returns 0. An unsuccessful receipt of the call returns one of the errorcodes shown in the errormsg list.
    detail string. Message text that the system may send.

    APAD-Related Calls

    These are User-category calls relating to APAD.

    Background: APAD Private Shares API

    APAD (AlphaPoint Asset Digitization) allows organizations to create and monetize assets that are not national or cryptocurrencies, and to offer them on the AlphaPoint Exchange.

    The Private Shares API (PSAPI) is a web socket server and API that augments the AlphaPoint Exchange API. It adds the concepts of asset issuers (essentially, companies) and provides additional roles for the management of digital assets; for example, company admin, company agent, company shareholder, investor, or marketmaker.

    • All APAD calls are asynchronous (in the general APEX API, some calls are synchronous).

    • The Digitizer is a separate application that creates and manages smart contracts (currently exclusive to Ethereum). Digitizer makes minimal contact with the APEX API. The APAD Private Shares API handles the connection with the Exchange software, and works with the rest of the APEX API.

    Requesting and Receiving a Reply

    The PSAPI is an asynchronous Websocket API. All requests are formatted as remote procedure calls (RPC calls and replies), as shown in Example 1 and Example 2.

    Example 1: Request Format

    {
    "MessageType":"RPCCall",
    "FunctionName":"<name of call>",
    "Parameter":"<payload>",
    "RequestUniqueId":"6271980a-30c7-4288-9b58-26fb75706b3b"
}

    Example 1 Fields

    Key Value
    MessageType string. The type of message. Always "RPCCall" for calls.
    FunctionName string. The name of the API call — for example "CreateUser" or "GetCompanies".
    Parameter string. The key-value pairs of the call, as detailed in this API.
    RequestUniqueId string. The globally unique identifier (GUID) for this call.

    Example 2: Reply Format

    {
    "MessageType":"RCPReply",
    "Parameter":"<stringified JSON object>",
    "RequestUniqueId":"6271980a-30c7-4288-9b58-26fb75706b3b"
}

    Example 2 Fields

    Key Value
    MessageType string. The type of message. Always "RCPReply" for replies.
    Parameter string. Stringified JSON; usually key-value pairs, as detailed in this API.
    RequestUniqueId string An echo of the GUID sent in the request.

    Unlike the APEX API generally, the APAD response can indicate whether the system has been acted upon; that is, it can tell you whether the call was successful, rather than telling you only that the system has received your call. You can always confirm the action of a Request by sending GetAssets, GetCompanies, or GetUsers.

    Example 3 shows a successful receipt of a call, and Example 4 shows an unsuccessful receipt of a call.

    Example 3: Successful receipt

    {
    "success":true,
    "payload":"<stringified JSON object>"
}

    Example 4: Unsuccessful receipt

    {
    "success":false,
    "err":"Operation Not Supported"
}

    Authentication

    To use the APAD API, a user first authenticates with the AlphaPoint Exchange, using the APEX API (for example, using AuthenticateUser) to obtain a sessionId. That session ID must be passed to the APAD API with every request. It uniquely identifies the user — and all of that user's permissions and roles — for the current session.

    The Version call does not require authentication.

    Objects

    The calls and their responses work with objects. There is an Asset object, a Company object, and a User object that appear repeatedly in Requests and Responses, along with various arrays of information. Not all key-value pairs in each object are used in every Request or Response; sometimes they will be null or 0.

    Time Fields

    All date-and-time fields in the APAD calls are strings. These strings can hold any date and time format that you want. However, AlphaPoint strongly suggests using Microsoft Ticks format (explained in the APEX API Background Information section), which is used extensively in the APEX API where dates and times are designated as strings. In the APEX API, all dates and times are provided in UTC — Universal Time (Greenwich Mean Time), regardless of where the Exchange is nominally located.

    User roles

    A user can have more than one role. The user's role determines what information is available to the user. The RoleName and CompanyRoll designations are used in different places in the calls, but share the same concept.

    Role Class Role Meaning
    RoleName CoAdmin Company administrator for a specific company. A user may have the CoAdmin role for more than one company. A user who is CoAdmin must also be CoShareholder.
    CoShareholder The user is a designated shareholder in a specific company. A user may be a CoShareholder in more than one company.
    CoAgent The user can act as agent for a specific company and trade on their behalf. A user may be a CoAgent in more than one company.
    CompanyRole CompanyAdmin Company administrator for a specific company. A user may have the CompanyAdmin role for more than one company. A user who is CompanyAdmin must also be CompanyShareholder.
    CompanyShareholder The user is a designated shareholder in a specific company. A user may be a CompanyShareholder in more than one company.
    CompanyAgent The user can act as agent for a specific company and trade on their behalf. A user may be a CompanyAgent in more than one company.
    GlobalRole Enabled The user has been through the verification process of the AlphaPoint Exchange.
    PlatformAdmin The user is an APAD SUPERUSER or Operator, and able to access all companies, users, and assets.
    Investor The user is a qualified investor under the law. These laws may vary from country to country.
    MarketMaker The user is designated a MarketMaker and may quote on the Exchange.

    Summary of calls

    This table shows the calls grouped by purpose. The calls appear alphabetically in the documentation.

    Purpose Calls Function
    Assets CreateAsset Creates a new asset and defines its attributes.
    TransferAsset Transfers (grants) an asset from a company to a user.
    ClawbackShares Reverses the transfer of shares.
    SetAssetAccessForUser Specifies what assets a user is able to access.
    GetAssets Return an array of assets a user can act on (depending on user permissions).
    Company CreateCompany Creates a new company (issuer).
    CreateCompanyWithUser Creates a new company along with a new user to be Company Admin (CoAdmin). The user also becomes Company Shareholder (CoShareholder).
    CreateCompanyWithExistingUser Creates a new company and designates an existing user to be Company Admin. The user also becomes Company Shareholder.
    RemoveAllCoAdmins Removes all Company Admin roles from a specific company.
    GetCompanies Returns an array of company information pertinent to the calling user's permissions.
    UpdateCompanyAddRoles Adds roles to a specified user for a specified company.
    Users CreateUser Creates a new user along with a default account for that user on the AlphaPoint Exchange.
    CreateCoAdmin Creates a new user and designates that user as Company Admin (and Company Shareholder) for an existing company.
    CreateUserAgent Creates a new user and designates that user as an Agent for the specified existing company.
    CreateUserCoShareholder Creates a new user and designates that user as Company Shareholder of the specified company.
    GetUsers Returns an array of user information (depending on the caller's permissions).
    GetUserFromSession Returns all information about the specified user session.
    GetUserAccountBalances Returns an associative array of user account balances by asset name.
    RemoveUserRole Removes the specified role from the specified user at the specified company.
    UpdateUser Sets and removes the Global Roles of Enabled, PlatformAdmin, Investor, and MarketMaker.
    General Version Returns the version number of the RPC package from the package.json file.

    ClawbackShares

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: CompanyAdmin for the company that issued the shares

    Reverses a transfer of shares, moving them from a user back to the company that issued them.

    The caller must be a CompanyAdmin of the issuer (company) of the shares.

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "6271980a-30c7-4288-9b58-26fb75706b3b",
    "assetname": "WMFS",
    "user": "jsmith",
    "amount": 200,
    "comments": ""
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the current user's logged-in session.
    assetName string. The short name of the asset whose shares are being reversed, for example, "WMFS" for Windmill Farm Shares.
    user string. The name of the user from whom the shares will be retrieved.
    amount real. The number of shares being retrieved, not the monetary value. This number must be positive, but it may be a fraction, such as 2.5.
    comments string. Any comments about the reversal.

    Reply

    {
    "AssetName":"WMFS",
    "CompanyName":"Windmill Farms, Inc.",
    "FromOwnerName":"jsmith",
    "ToOwnerName":"Windmill Farms, Inc.",
    "Amount":200,
    "TransactionId":"05c84513"

}
    Key Value
    AssetName string. The name of the asset that was transfered and is now being reversed.
    CompanyName: string. The name of the company whose company admin is making the reversal request.
    FromOwnerName string. The name of the company (or user) surrendering the shares.
    ToOwnerName string. The name of the company receiving the shares.
    Amount real. The number of shares (and fraction of shares) being reversed (not the monetary value of the shares).
    TransactionId string. The ID of the transaction that reverses the share transfer. Assigned by the system in the Reply.

    CreateAsset

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (Operator)

    Creates a new asset in the system and defines its attributes. The same call creates the asset on the AlphaPoint Exchange and associates the asset with the company named in CompanyName so that CompanyName can supply the asset to the Exchange — for example, they can offer shares in the “Windmill Farms” enterprise.

    The asset created here appears on the AlphaPoint Exchange as a product or instrument, with settable verification levels and the other controls available on the Exchange and through the APEX API.

    The number TotalIssued that returns in the Reply represents the total amount of the asset that has been deposited on hte AlphaPoint Exchange. Obviously, when creating an asset, nothing has yet been deposited.

    In order to deposit an asset on the Exchange you create the asset here and separately in the Asset Digitizer, and then use an Account Provider that already has been set up on the Exchange to make the actual deposit of assets.

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "6271980a-30c7-4288-9b58-26fb75706b3b",
    "assetName": "WMFS",
    "assetFullName": "Windmill Farm Shares"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current user's logged-in session.
    assetName string. The short name, or nickname, of the asset. For example, WMFS for Windmill Farm Shares. Must be a non-empty string, for example " ".
    assetFullName string. The full name of the asset (not the company creating the asset). For example, Windmill Farm Shares. Must be a non-empty string, for example " ".

    Reply

    {
    "AssetName": "WMFS",
    "AssetFullName": "Windmill Farm Shares",
    "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "AssetId": "6271980a-30c7-4288-9b58-26fb75706b3b",
    "TotalIssued": 0
}
    Key Value
    AssetName string. The short name of the asset that is being created and associated with a company. For example, WMFS for Windmill Farm Shares.
    AssetFullName string. A longer version of the name of the asset being created. For example, Windmill Farm Shares.
    CompanyName string. The name of the company associated with the newly created product, for example, Windmill Farm, Inc.
    AssetId string. A globally unique identifier for the asset assigned by the system.
    TotalIssued real. The total number of asset items (or fractions of them) added to the exchange for trading. Not the monetary value. For a new asset, this number is always 0, because no asset items — as yet — have been added to the exchange.

    CreateCoAdmin

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (Operator)

    Simultaneously creates a new user and designates that new user as company admin for the named company (issuer).

    Note:
    • The company must already exist.
    • The userName and the user's email address must be unique across the AlphaPoint Exchange.
    • Any user granted the CompanyAdmin role is also granted the CompanyShareholder role (even if that user does not hold shares).

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "6271980a-30c7-4288-9b58-26fb75706b3b",
    "companyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "userName": "jsmith",
    "isEnabled": false,
    "email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "password": "abracadabra"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current user's logged-in session.
    companyName string. The name of the company for which the new user will be company admin. The new user is also granted the CompanyShareholder role along with CompanyAdmin.
    userName string. The login name of the new user on the system. The value for userName must be unique across the AlphaPoint Exchange.
    isEnabled Boolean. A value of false signifies that the user must email-verify before becoming active. Usually, this takes place on the next attempted log-in. Defaults to false. A value of true signifies that the user does not need to email-verify, and can begin activity upon log-in.
    email string. The email address of the user being created and designated as company admin. The email address must be unique across the AlphaPoint Exchange.
    password string. The password of the user being created and designated as CompanyAdmin.

    Reply

    {
    "Permissions": ["CompanyAdmin","CompanyShareholder"],
    "RoleNamesByCompanyName": {"Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoAdmin",
                               "Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoShareholder"},
    "UserName": "jsmith",
    "ExternalId": 8102
}
    Key Value
    Permissions array. Returns an array of permissions that this user currently holds. The list is drawn from the following roles and global roles:
    Enabled
    PlatformAdmin
    Investor
    MarketMaker
    CompanyAdmin
    CompanyShareholder
    CompanyAgent

    Because this is a new user being created as CompanyAdmin, and a CompanyAdmin must also be a CompanyShareholder, the return should be both CompanyAdmin and CompanyShareholder. If the value for isEnabled is true in the Request, Permissions will also return Enabled.
    RoleNamesByCompanyName object. Returns a list of key-value pairs consisting of the company name (companyName in the request) and the name of a role that this user has been given for this company. Since this is a new user without prior role, and the new user is being made a company admin (and company shareholder), the roles returned here should be CoAdmin and CoShareholder.
    UserName string. The user name of the new user.
    ExternalId integer. The user ID of the user being made a company admin, returned from the AlphaPoint Exchange.

    CreateCompany

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (Operator)

    Creates a new company (issuer).

    Note: It is rare to create a company by itself. More usually, you will create a company and a user to be CoAdmin simultaneously (CreateCompanyWithUser or create a company and designate an existing user as CoAdmin (CreateCompanyWithExistingUser).

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "f2fd8caa-cee6-4590-b868-0ebb2adb5968",
    "companyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "country": "USA",
    "stateOrProvinceOfIncorporation": "Delaware",
    "incorporationDate": "2018-08-17T17:57:56Z",
    "accountingCurrency": "USD"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current user's logged-in session.
    companyName string. The name of the company being created.
    country string. The name of the country where the company is located.
    stateOrProvinceOfIncorporation string. The name of the state or province where the company is incorporated. (This may not be the location of the company's principal office.)
    incorporationDate string. The time and date stamp of when the company was incorporated, in Microsoft Ticks format. The time and date are always given as UTC. This is not strictly enforced in the APAD calls, but it is a Best Practice.
    accountingCurrency string. The name of the currency in which the company does its accounting. For example, USD for US Dollars.

    Reply

    {
    "CompanyId": 5150,
    "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "Roles": [],
    "UserNames": [],
    "AssetNames": [],
    "OnExchangeBalancesByAssetName": {},
    "Country": "USA",
    "StateOrProvinceOfIncorporation": "Delaware",
    "IncorporationDate": "2018-08-17T17:57:56Z",
    "AccountingCurrency": "USD",
    "OffExchangeBalancesByAssetName": {}
}
    Key Value
    CompanyId integer. ID assigned by the system to the new company.
    CompanyName string. Name of the new company echoed back.
    Roles array. An array that is a set of objects holding key-value pairs, each object consisting of:
    RoleName — CoAdmin / CoShareholder / CoAgent
    UserName — an array of users who hold that role in the company
    CompanyName — a restatement of the name of the company in which the array of user names hold their roles.

    This array will be unpopulated because the company is new.
    UserNames array. An array of strings listing the user names of users already associated with this company. Because this call creates a new company and that company is currently without users, the UserNames array will be unpopulated.
    AssetNames array. An array of strings, each string listing the full name of an asset this company brings to the exchange. Because this call creates a new company and that company is currently without assets, the AssetNames array will be unpopulated.
    OnExchangeBalancesByAssetName array. An array of key-value pairs consisting of an asset name and a number representing the amount of that asset belonging to the company and currently available on the exchange. Because this call creates a new company, the company will not have assets already on the exchange, and this array will be empty.
    Country string. The name of the country where the company is located, echoed back from the request.
    StateOrProvinceOfIncorporation string. The name of the state or province where the company is incorporated. This is echoed back from the request, and may not be the principal office of the company.
    IncorporationDate string. The date and time stamp of when the company was incorporated, echoed back from the Requeset. The date and time should be in Microsoft Ticks format and given as UTC.
    AccountingCurrency string. The currency in which the company's accounting takes place. For example, USD for US Dollars.
    OffExchangeBalancesByAssetName object. DEPRECATED Returns a list of key-value pairs consisting of an asset name and a number representing the amount of that asset belonging to the company and not currently available on the exchange. In current implementations, always returns empty.

    CreateCompanyWithExistingUser

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (Operator)

    Creates a new company and assigns an existing Exchange user as the company administrator (CoAdmin). There can be more than one company administrator assigned to a company. The user must already exist on the AlphaPoint Exchange, but can be any user.

    A user given the role CompanyAdmin will also be given the role CompanyShareholder, even if that user does not hold shares.

    Warning: You must have created the "existing Exchange user" previously via APAD API calls, otherwise the user will not be set up properly on the Exchange with all the required database entries. Other APAD calls would fail.

    This call is similar to CreateCompanyWithUser, which creates a new user along with the company; and to CreateCoAdmin, where a new user is created and assigned to an existing company.

    Note: Essentially, CreateCompanyWithExitingUser appends a user name to the CreateCompany call.

    Request

    Essentially, CreateCompanyWithExistingUser appends a user name to the CreateCompany call.

    {
    "sessionId": "36bafdfc-781c-4448-8cba-83c8f60e6ed0",
    "companyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "country": "USA",
    "stateOrProvinceOfIncorporation": "Delaware",
    "incorporationDate": "2018-08-17T17:57:56Z",
    "accountingCurrency": "USD",
    "userName": "jsmith"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current user's logged-in session.
    companyName string. The name of the company being created.
    country string. The name of the country where the company is located.
    stateOrProvinceOfIncorporation string. The name of the state or province where the company is incorporated. (This may not be the location of the company's principal office.)
    incorporationDate string. The time and date stamp of when the company was incorporated. Best Practice is to state this in Microsoft Ticks format; give the time and date as UTC.
    accountingCurrency string. The name of the currency in which the company does its accounting. For example, USD for US Dollars.
    userName string. The user name of the user who will be new company's company admin (CoAdmin). The user must already exist on the AlphaPoint Exchange.

    Response

    {
    "Company": {
        "CompanyId": 8102,
        "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
        "Roles": [
            {
            "RoleName": "CoAdmin",
            "UserName": ["jsmith"],
            "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc."
        },
        {
            "RoleName": "CoShareholder",
            "UserName": ["jsmith"],
            "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc."
             }
            ],
        "UserNames": ["jsmith"],
        "AssetNames": [],
        "OnExchangeBalancesByAssetName": {},
        "Country": "USA",
        "StateOrProvinceOfIncorporation": "Delaware",
        "IncorporationDate": "2018-08-17T17:57:56Z",
        "AccountingCurrency": "USD",
        "OffExchangeBalancesByAssetName": {}
    },
    "User":{
        "Permissions": ["CompanyAdmin",
                        "CompanyShareholder",
                        "Investor",
                        "MarketMaker"],
        "RoleNamesByCompanyName": {"Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoAdmin",
                                   "Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoShareholder",
                                   "Smith & Co.": "CoShareholder"},
        "UserName": "jsmith",
        "Email": "user@alphapoint.com",
        "ExternalId": 5150
    }
}

    The response to the call combines the full Response to CreateCompany and the full Response to CreateUser in two JSON objects — Company and User as shown in the code snippet.

    Company object

    Key Value
    CompanyId integer. ID assigned by the system to the new company.
    CompanyName string. Name of the new company echoed back.
    Roles array. An array that is a set of key-value pairs, each set consisting of:
    RoleName — CoAdmin / CoShareholder / CoAgent
    UserName — an array of users who hold that role in the company
    CompanyName — a restatement of the name of the company in which the array of user names hold their roles.

    This call creates a new company that has no other users, and assigns the single existing user the role of CoAdmin. Any user assigned CoAdmin also must have the role CoShareholder (even if the user does not hold shares). This array returns two objects: one with the user assigned CoAdmin, and one with the user assigned CoShareholder.
    UserNames array. An array of strings listing the user names of users already associated with this company. Because this call creates a new company and has only the single CoAdmin, the array should return a single user name.
    AssetNames array. An array of strings, each string listing the full name of an asset the company brings to the exchange. Because this call creates a new company, that company has not yet brought any assets to the Exchange, and the AssetNames array will be unpopulated.
    OnExchangeBalancesByAssetName array. An array of key-value pairs consisting of an asset name and a number representing the amount of that asset belonging to the company and currently available on the exchange. Because this call creates a new company, the new company will have no assets already on the exchange, and this array will be empty.
    Country string. The name of the country where the company is located, echoed back from the request.
    StateOrProvinceOfIncorporation string. The name of the state or province where the company is incorporated. This is echoed back from the request, and may not be the principal office of the company.
    IncorporationDate string. The date and time stamp of when the company was incorporated, echoed back from the Request. It is Best Practice for this time stamp to be in Microsoft Ticks format and UTC.
    AccountingCurrency string. The currency in which the company's accounting takes place. For example, USD for US Dollars.
    OffExchangeBalancesByAssetName array. DEPRECATED Returns an array of key-value pairs consisting of an asset name and a number representing the amount of that asset belonging to the company and not available on the exchange. In current implementations, usually returns an empty array.

    User object

    Key Value
    Permissions array. Returns a string array of roles and permissions that this user currently holds (both in and out of this specific new company). The permissions are drawn from these roles:
    Enabled
    PlatformAdmin
    Investor
    MarketMaker
    CompanyAdmin
    CompanyShareholder
    CompanyAgent

    The existing user of the call is being made CompanyAdmin for the new company and must also be CompanyShareholder of that company, so the CompanyAdmin and CompanyShareholder permissions should appear. An existing user may have additional permissions.
    RoleNamesByCompanyName array. Returns an array of key-value pairs consisting of a company name and the name of a role that this user has been given for this company. This should return the name of the new company, CoAdmin, and CoShareholder.
    UserName string. The name of the user, echoed back from the Request.
    Email string. The email address of the user, echoed back from the Request.
    ExternalId integer. The AlphaPoint user ID of the user.

    CreateCompanyWithUser

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin

    Simultaneously creates a new company and creates a new user who becomes Company Administrator for that company. The user named as Company Administrator cannot previously exist on the AlphaPoint Exchange. A use who is created Company Administrator is also created Company Shareholder in that company (even if the user does not hold shares).

    Note: Essentially, CreateCompanyWithUser appends new user information to the CreateCompany call. In this, it is similar to CreateCompanyWithExstingUser.

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "55caa1f6-d8c9-4c70-957f-70f6cbac715a",
    "companyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "country": "USA",
    "stateOrProvinceOfIncorporation": "Delaware",
    "incorporationDate": "2018-08-17T17:57:56Z",
    "accountingCurrency": "USD",
    "userName": "jsmith",
    "isEnabled": false,
    "email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "password": "abracadabra"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current logged-in session.
    companyName string. The full name of the company being created.
    country string. The name of the country where the new company has its headquarters.
    stateOrProvinceOfIncorporation string. The name of the state or province where the company is incorporated. (This may or may not be the location of the company's principal office.)
    incorporationDate string. The time and date stamp of when the company was incorporated, in Microsoft Ticks format. The time is always given as UTC.
    accountingCurrency string. The name of the currency in which the company does its accounting. For example, USD for US Dollars.
    userName string. The name of the new Company Administrator user being added along with the new company.
    isEnabled Boolean. A value of fasle signifies that the user must email-verify before becoming active. Usually, this takes place on the next attempted log-in. Defaults to false. A value of true signifies that the user does not need to email-verify, and can begin activity upon log-in.
    email string. The email address of the Company Administrator user being added with the newly created company.
    password string. The password for the new administrative user.

    Reply

    {
    "Company": {
        "CompanyId": 8102,
        "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
        "Roles": [
            {
            "RoleName": "CoAdmin",
            "UserName": ["jsmith"],
            "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc."
        },
        {
            "RoleName": "CoShareholder",
            "UserName": ["jsmith"],
            "CompanyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc."
             }
            ],
        "UserNames": ["jsmith"],
        "AssetNames": [],
        "OnExchangeBalancesByAssetName": {},
        "Country": "USA",
        "StateOrProvinceOfIncorporation": "Delaware",
        "IncorporationDate": "2018-08-17T17:57:56Z",
        "AccountingCurrency": "USD",
        "OffExchangeBalancesByAssetName": {}
    },
    "User":{
        "Permissions": ["CompanyAdmin",
                        "CompanyShareholder"],
        "RoleNamesByCompanyName": {"Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoAdmin",
                                   "Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoShareholder"},
        "UserName": "jsmith",
        "Email": "user@alphapoint.com",
        "ExternalId": 5150
    }
}

    The Reply to the Request combines the full Response to CreateCompany and the full Response to CreateUser in two JSON objects — Company and User as shown in the code snippet.

    Company object

    Company object information pertains specifically to the new company being created.

    Key Value
    CompanyId integer. ID assigned by the system to the new company.
    CompanyName string. Name of the new company, echoed back from the Request.at
    Roles array. An array that is a set of key-value pairs, each set consisting of:
    RoleName — CoAdmin / CoShareholder / CoAgent
    UserName — An array of users who hold that role in the company.
    CompanyName — A restatement of the name of the company in which the array of user names hold their roles.

    The call creates a new company that has no users, and then creates a new user to be Company Administrator (CoAdmin). Any user who is created CoAdmin automatically is created Company Shareholder (even if that user does not hold any shares, and a newly created user cannot already hold shares). This array returns two objects: one with the new user assigned CoAdmin, and the other with the same user assigned CoShareholder.
    UserNames array. An array of strings listing the user names of users already associated with this company. Because this call creates a new company with one user associated with it, the array contains that single user name.
    AssetNames array. An array of strings, each string listing the full name of an asset that the company brings to the Exchange. Because the call creates a new company, that company has not had an opportunity to bring assets to the Exchange. AssetNames will be unpopulated.
    OnExchangeBalancesByAssetName array. An array of key-value pairs consisting of an asset name and a number representing the amount of that asset belonging to the company and currently available on the Exchange. Because this call creates a new company, the new company will not yet have any assets currently available on the Exchange. The OnExchangeBalancesByAssetName array will be empty.
    Country string. The name of the country where the company is located, echoed back from the Request.
    StateOrProvinceOfIncorporation string. The name of the state or province where the company is incorporated, echoed back from the Request. This may not be the principal office of the company.
    IncorporationDate string. The date and time stamp of when the company was incorporated, echoed back from the Request.
    AccountingCurrency string. The currency in which the company's accounting takes place. For example, USD for US Dollars.
    OffExchangeBalancesByAssetName array. DEPRECATED Returns an array of key-value pairs consisting of an asset name and a number representing the amount of that asset belonging to the company and not available on the Exchange. In current implementations, returns an empty array.

    User object

    User object information pertains specifically to the user being created.

    Key Value
    Permissions array. Returns an array of roles and permissions that this user currently holds (both in this new company and in any other company). The permissions are drawn from these roles:
    Enabled
    PlatformAdmin
    Investor
    MarketMaker
    CompanyAdmin
    CompanyShareholder
    CompanyAgent

    The new user is being made both Company Admin of the new Company and Company Shareholder, so CompanyAdmin and CompanyShareholder permissions will appear. The user is new, so will not have other permissions in this or other companies.
    RoleNamesByCompanyName array. Returns an array of key-value pairs that consist of a company name and the name of a role that this user has been given for the named company. The company names can be drawn from any company with which the user is associated. Because the user is new (as well as the company), the array will have two key-value pairs: the name of the new company and the roles CompanyAdmin and CompanyShareholder.
    UserName string. The name of the new user, echoed back from the Request.
    Email string. The email address of the new user, echoed back from the Request.
    ExternalId integer. The user ID of the new user assigned by the AlphaPoint Exchange.

    CreateUser

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (can create a PlatformAdmin), CompanyAdmin

    Creates a new APAD user on the AlphaPoint Exchange along with a default account on the AlphaPoint Exchange for that user. The new user is not yet associated with any company, even when created by a CoAdmin. The call also assigns the set of attributes listed in the Request.

    Warning: Any APAD call that requires a user (for example, CreateCompanyWithExistingUser), requires that user to have been created using APAD calls. APAD and AlphaPoint Exchange users both appear in the Exchange; but only APAD-created users can be used by APAD calls.

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "38b4a0f0-eeca-41c7-91e8-ce316f701546",
    "userName": "jsmith",
    "isEnabled": false,
    "isNotVerified": false,
    "isPlatformAdmin": false,
    "isInvestor": true,
    "isMarketMaker": true,
    "email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "password": "abracadabra"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current user's logged-in session.
    userName string. The log-in name of the user being created. The userName value must be unique on the Exchange.
    isEnabled Boolean. A value of false signifies that the user must email-verify before becoming active. Usually, this takes place on the next attempted log-in. Defaults to false. A value of true signifies that the user does not need to email-verify, and can begin activity upon log-in.
    isNotVerified Boolean. DEPRECATED This value is true if the new user has not been verified automatically by a KYC (Know Your Customer) system, or manually by an AlphaPoint Exchange admin. The value is false if the new user has been verified. You can safely leave this field out of the Request.
    isPlatformAdmin Boolean. This value is true if the new user has been assigned the role of PlatformAdmin (Exchange operator); the value is false if the new user has not been assigned this role. A CompanyAdmin calling CreateUser cannot create a PlatformAdmin. This field defaults to false.
    IsInvestor Boolean. This value is true if the new user is a qualified investor under the law; otherwise false.
    isMarketMaker Boolean. This value is true if the new user has the role of market maker. Only a market maker may quote on the AlphaPoint Exchange.
    email string. The email address of the new user.
    password string. The password of the new user.

    Reply

    {
    "Permissions": ["Investor","MarketMaker"],
    "RoleNamesByCompanyName": {},
    "UserName": "jsmith",
    "Email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "ExternalId": 8102
}
    Key Value
    Permissions array. Returns a string array of permissions that this user currently holds. The permissions are drawn from:
    Enabled
    PlatformAdmin
    Investor
    MarketMaker
    CompanyAdmin
    CompanyShareholder
    CompanyAgent

    Because a new user is being created by the CreateUser call, permissions do not exist for the user except if any of the Booleans isPlatformAdmin, isInvestor, or isMarketMaker was set to true in the request.
    RoleNamesByCompanyName array. Returns an array of key-value pairs consisting of a company name and the name of a role that this user has been given for that company. Since this is a new user without a prior role or company connection (yet), this will return an empty array.
    UserName string. The user name of the new user, echoed back from the Request.
    Email string. The email address of the new user, echoed back from the Request.
    ExternalId integer. The AlphaPoint user ID of the user being created, assigned by the Exchange.

    CreateUserAgent

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (for any company or user), CompanyAdmin (for the specified company only)

    Creates a new user in the AlphaPoint exchange and assigns that user as an agent of the specified company. The company must already exist.

    A company agent (CoAgent, or CompanyAgent), can trade or act in other ways on the company's behalf — as opposed to simply holding some token or share in the company. A user may be named as CoAgent for more than one company.

    A user with CompanyAdmin permission can create a company agent only for companies for which the CompanyAdmin user is administrator; a PlatformAdmin can create a company agent for any company.

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "6553d6fa-517f-405a-b9ce-ce758bf2ef97",
    "companyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "userName": "jsmith",
    "isEnabled": false,
    "email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "password": "abracadabra"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current user's logged-in session.
    companyName string. The company for whom the new user is named as agent.
    userName string. The user name of the new user who is agent.
    isEnabled Boolean. A value of false signifies that the user must email-verify before becoming active on the Exchange. Usually, this takes place on the next attempted log-in. Defaults to false. A value of true signifies that the user does not need to email-verify, and can begin activity upon log-on.
    email string. The email of the new user being named as agent. Must be unique across the Exchange.
    password string. The password of the new user being named as agent.

    Reply

    {
    "Permissions": ["CompanyAgent"],
    "RoleNamesByCompanyName": {"Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoAgent"},
    "UserName": "jsmith",
    "Email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "ExternalId": 8102
}
    Key Value
    Permissions array. Returns a string array of permissions that this user currently holds. The permissions are drawn from:
    Enabled
    PlatformAdmin
    Investor
    MarketMaker
    CompanyAdmin
    CompanyShareholder
    CompanyAgent

    Because CreateUserAgent creates a new user (who has no prior permissions or roles), the Permissions array returns only CompanyAgent — the permission assigned by the call.
    RoleNamesByCompanyName array. Returns an array of key-value pairs consisting of a company name and the name of a role that this user has been given for that company. Since this is a new user who has been given only the company agent role (so far), this field returns the company name and CoAgent.
    UserName string. The name of the user being made an agent.
    Email string. The email of the user being made an agent.
    ExternalId integer. The AlphaPoint user ID of the new user,

    CreateUserCoShareholder

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (for any company or user), CompanyAdmin (for the specified company only)

    Creates a new user on the AlphaPoint Exchange and assigns that user the role of CompanyShareholder (CoShareholder) in a specific company. A company shareholder possesses shares or tokens in a company. The call TransferAsset grants shares or tokens from a company to a user. The call ClawbackShares retrieves shares or tokens from a user and returns them to a company.

    A user may be a CompanyShareholder in more than one company.

    The company must already exist before creating the CompanyShareholder user.

    A user with CompanyAdmin permission can create a company shareholder user only for companies for which the CompanyAdmin user is administrator; a PlatformAdmin can create a company shareholder user for any company.

    Request

    {
    "sessionId": "7747d8e4-d389-43ae-b640-3f495266652b",
    "companyName": "Windmill Farm, Inc.",
    "userName": "jsmith",
    "isEnabled": false,
    "email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "password": "abracadabra"
}
    Key Value
    sessionId string. The globally unique identifier for the current user's logged-in session.
    companyName string. The company in which the new user will be a shareholder.
    userName string. The user name of the new user who will be the shareholder.
    isEnabled Boolean. A value of false signifies that the new user must email-verify before becoming active on the Exchange. Usually, this takes place on the next attempted log-in. Defaults to false. A value of true signifies that the user does not need to email-verify, and can begin activity upon log-in.
    email string. The email address of the user who is being created and made a shareholder.
    password string. The password for the new user.

    Reply

    {
    "Permissions": ["CompanyShareholder"],
    "RoleNamesByCompanyName": {"Windmill Farm, Inc.": "CoShareholder"},
    "UserName": "jsmith",
    "Email": "user@alphapoint.com",
    "ExternalId": 8102
}
    Key Value
    Permissions array. Returns a string array of permissions that this user currently holds. The permissions are drawn from:
    Enabled
    PlatformAdmin
    Investor
    MarketMaker
    CompanyAdmin
    CompanyShareholder
    CompanyAgent

    Because the user is being created (and has no prior permissions or roles), the Permissions array returns only CompanyShareholder — the permission that is being assigned by the call.
    RoleNamesByCompanyName array. Returns an array of key-value pairs consisting of a company name and the name of a role that this user has been given for this company. Since this is a new user who has been given the company shareholder role by this call, this field returns the company name and CoShareholder.
    UserName string. The name of the new user being assigned the role of shareholder.
    Email string. The email address of the new user being assigned the role of shareholder.
    ExternalId integer. The AlphaPoint user ID of the new user.

    GetAssets

    Category: APAD
    Permissions: PlatformAdmin (sees assets from all companies), CompanyAdmin, CompanyAgent, CompanyShareholder (see assets from companies with which they're associated)
